Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk attica
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: kde-workspace, attica, bluedevil, and qt bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The K Desktop Environment (KDE) is a graphical desktop environment for the X Window System. The kdelibs packages include core libraries for the K Desktop Environment. The attica packages provide a Qt library that implements the Open Collaboration Services API version 1.4. BlueDevil is a set of components that integrate Bluetooth in KDE. The libbluedevil packages provide a Qt-based library aimed at handling Bluetooth functionality. The kde-workspace packages have been upgraded to upstream version 4.14.8, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1026809) The attica packages have been upgraded to upstream version 0.4.2, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1026809) The bluedevil and libbluedevil packages have been upgraded to upstream version 2.1, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1026809) The qt packages have been updated to ensure correct operation on Power little endian or ARM 64-bit hardware architectures. (BZ#1125662) Users of KDE are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. The desktop must be restarted (log out, then log back in) for this update to take effect. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
